statement.tex: %text Write the direction ratios of the following line % x=-3, \dfrac{y-4}{3}=\dfrac{2-z}{1}

options.tex: %text The direction ratios along the $x$, $y$ and $z$ axes respectively are $0$, $3$ and $1$. %

reason.tex: %text The given equation can be rewritten as, % \begin{align} x=-3,\dfrac{y-4}{3}=\dfrac{z-2}{-1} \end{align} \\ %text Therefore, the correct direction ratios are $0$, $3$ and $-1$. %
